--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "torvhydda" <torvhydda@...> wrote:

> If I a=
m not mistaken all other nodes that have the source node in their
> A-list =
must also add the new node to their A-list.

Turns out I mistook myself. It=
 should of course be all nodes that have the gene end node in their A-list =
that needs to put the new node in their A-list.

_add_node(), _add_gene(), =
and enabling of genes in _toggle_enable() behaves kind of similar I think. =
Need to push something forward in the graph. Disabling of genes in _toggle_=
enable() is scarier. Not possible to traverse forward and mask out bits, si=
nce there can be more than one path leading to a node in the graph.

I impl=
emented it in another way. I do a complete graph traversal to build these b=
it arrays. Uploaded a patch to v0.7, aba.patch.gz.

I like this bit array i=
dea :). Gonna try to see if I save some CPU cycles.

/Magnus
